Description: The temptation of St Antony. The saint seated on a mound at right, holding a cross in his left hand and facing two demonic creatures at left Etching
Bibliographic references: Hollstein / Dutch and Flemish etchings, engravings and woodcuts c.1450-1700 (8.II)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition name: Bequeathed by: Clayton Mordaunt Cracherode (with Philipe's oval stamp and the initials CMC)
